org.acra.dialog

Class CrashReportDialogHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.acra.dialog.CrashReportDialogHelper

  • public class CrashReportDialogHelper
extends Object
    Use this class to integrate your custom crash report dialog with ACRA.
    Since:
    5.4.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CrashReportDialogHelper(Context context, Intent intent)
      Call this in your Activity.onCreate(Bundle).

    • Method Summary

      Cancel any pending crash reports.

      Provides the configuration

      loads the current report data

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrashReportDialogHelper

        public CrashReportDialogHelper(@NonNull
                               Context context,
                               @NonNull
                               Intent intent)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Call this in your Activity.onCreate(Bundle). The intent must contain two extras:
        1. DialogInteraction.EXTRA_REPORT_FILE
        2. DialogInteraction.EXTRA_REPORT_CONFIG
        Parameters:
        context - a context
        intent - the intent which started this activity
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the intent cannot be parsed or does not contain the correct data

    • Method Detail

      • getReportData

        @WorkerThread
 @NonNull
public CrashReportData getReportData()
                                                      throws IOException
        loads the current report data
        Returns:
        report data
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem with the report file

      • cancelReports

        public void cancelReports()
        Cancel any pending crash reports.

      • sendCrash

        public void sendCrash(@Nullable
                      String comment,
                      @Nullable
                      String userEmail)
        Send crash report given user's comment and email address.
        Parameters:
        comment - Comment (may be null) provided by the user.
        userEmail - Email address (may be null) provided by the user.

      • getConfig

        public CoreConfiguration getConfig()
        Provides the configuration
        Returns:
        the main config
